Reviews.Title: HTC 8XT
Reviews.Author: Tammi Confer
Reviews.Content: Phone works perfect. Sprint finally delivers a WP8, I wasn't crazy about the color and the specifications make it a mid tier phone. However this phone has exceeded all expectations. Beats Audio is superb and front facing speakers are great. Phone is very smooth operating. I haven't had one issue. Have had it for only a few days but so far perfect for its price. Cant really complain for 100 dollars. I will update if i have any issues.

Reviews.Title: Awesome phone with fatal design flaw
Reviews.Author: M. Miles "smilesonemillion"
Reviews.Content: the front facing speakers are great, since that is the direction speakers should face. The windows phone 8 OS is lovely and this phone executes it well. I loved the zune, and this a great zunephone.The flaw is in the design. The beveled edge means that the headphone jack is not secure. If you put this phone in your pocket to walk around and listen to music the headphone will disconnect pausing the music.

Reviews.Title: Awsome Phone
Reviews.Author: J. Cable
Reviews.Content: This is one great phone. Speedy and has an awesome camera. The back is tough to get off, but I see that a a plus since it will not fall off if dropped. Only thing is the Visual VoiceMail is not to my liking. The screen is really nice even though it is not 720p. Really light and feels good in your hand.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone!
Reviews.Author: MIchael Todd
Reviews.Content: For being forced into buying this phone (only Windows Phone on Sprint), it was a little depressing when it was revealed to have mid-range specs. But that isn't noticeable; the phone is fast and fluid, love Windows Phone 8, and the phone hardware itself looks great! Now I just need a case before I break this great piece of hardware.

Reviews.Title: amazing phone
Reviews.Author: chucky
Reviews.Content: No complaints about this phone. Love everything about it. If your considering a windows phone. This is the one to go with.

Reviews.Title: great phone at a great price
Reviews.Author: bryan
Reviews.Content: I got this phone because I wanted to try windows phone for Sprint. I loved it so much I got my wife one for Christmas. If u need GPS download the app HERE drive, its good and all the bing apps also to get the full experience. OneNote is nice also. Battery life is a plus.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING
Reviews.Author: talldad
Reviews.Content: Don't order this phone through Amazon, it will take months for you to receive it if you even get it at all.  Got mine at Radio Shack for half of the cost at the Sprint Store.  It's an amazing phone period.  The Windows OS is so much better than Android.  The battery is far superior to my old Galaxy S2.  Every app that I've wanted has been available in the Microsoft App Store.  The color is awesome, but I know some people complain about it.  The overall phone experience is so much better, faster, and smoother than Android.  I haven't had one issue!  The apps never "force close", which happened daily on Android.  Spread the word about Windows Phone OS and this amazing phone.  Buy one, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Fast and fun
Reviews.Author: Brian P. Sullivan "sullyrecords"
Reviews.Content: Just upgraded from HTC EVO 4G LTE and was amazed by the speed.  All the essentials apps are there.  I am very happy to give a few things up for a better overall experience.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Sekou
Reviews.Content: I love the sound of the boom sound especially with the ear buds the camera is great it's just an all-around amazing phone

Reviews.Title: Nice phone
Reviews.Author: CA2NCmom
Reviews.Content: I love the phone. It's nice looking and easy to use. I just wish Windows had more apps available for it.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad windows phone but...
Reviews.Author: C. Mcgill
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad Win phone at all, but compaired to the Nokia Lumia line it does not hold a candle.I've owned 4 different windows phone models - The Lumia 900, the 920, the 1520 (my current main phone) and the HTC 8X and I would say this is my least favorite. It just does not have the solid feel as the Lumia's do, not to say it is a bad phone because it isn't. It just is a good bit lighter and cheaper feeling than those phones. So if you want a good compact smart phone and light weight and pocket entry smoothness is important to you - consider this one. Otherwise, get one of the better Lumia's

Reviews.Title: HTC 8X
Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: Love it.  this phone has opened up a whole new world of apps to me.  Great deal...glad I got it.

Reviews.Title: Love syncing to my Surface Pro tablet
Reviews.Author: kim
Reviews.Content: The app for Candy crush is not available and the processor is kind of slow. Overall, it is a great phone. I love the beats audio and Windows OS with the live tiles.

Reviews.Title: Another great Windows Phone
Reviews.Author: Tommy Graves
Reviews.Content: WP8 phones really seem to have a knack for hardware. The purplish blue 8XT is absolutely stunning. This phone runs fast thanks to Windows Phone 8. Of course, some apps that you'll find on Android and iOS are still missing, but for my purposes the 8XT is doing great. This thing feels much pricier than it is, and with little benefits like the SD card slot, it's a killer value. Do note the low resolution on the phone - but if your eyesight, like mine, isn't great, you won't be able to notice!

Reviews.Title: Good phone
Reviews.Author: Q
Reviews.Content: The phone is great. Better than I thought based on the resolution. The back is VERY hard to remove and I thought I would break the front but I was able to open it a few times and inserted the SD card. Used an extra USB to sync with the computer.Only issue so far is my Google contacts will not sync the phone numbers on the People hub. I may have to input the data on my Hotmail account and that should resolve the issue. It just sucks I would have to duplicate my efforts.Used the alarm on it and it woke me up. Overall, a good phone but the OS definitely needs a bit more tweaking. I hope to find a very good streaming app that I sacrificed when I went from iPhone to Android to Windows. Songza is an EXCELLENT music streaming app!

Reviews.Title: Disapointing
Reviews.Author: Austin N Dyer
Reviews.Content: For any other fellow Sprint customers who are WP lovers you know we've been waiting for this phone for a long time.  The phone seems wonderful and I want to love it but the issues I'm having are impossible to ignore.  Let me reiterate that I am a huge Windows Phone fan and I loved my HTC Arrive that I had before I upgraded, so for me to say this phone is disappointing is a big deal.  The first and most terrible issue is the light sensor that is supposed to turn the screen off when you hold the phone to your face to prevent you from accidental input when on the phone (all touch screen phones have this in case you don't know for some reason).  The sensor simply doesn't work in outdoor conditions where there is a lot of light.  This makes it extremely difficult and almost impossible to talk outside as my face is constantly mashing the end call button.  The other glaring issue is the speakers when streaming music or video.  They often crackle and sound like there is static even when you have a perfect 4g or wifi signal.  For a phone that markets itself as a music playing device (the phone has Beats Audio and Boom Sound front facing speakers) you can see how this would be extra disappointing.  Its also worth noting that I shattered my screen so I had to order a replacement device and I'm still encountering both of these issues so its not just a problem with my one particular model.  I've seen several professional review sites mention both of those issues as well so it appears that these are issues across all or many models.  Also for any non-windows phone faithful out there who don't know any better I feel its only fair to warn you that many popular apps are absent from the Windows Phone marketplace (It is expanding quite rapidly though).  Us windows phone fans have excepted this and suck it up but to someone used to the choices provided by the Apple (Yuck) or Android markets you may be very disappointed to find out that official versions of apps like SnapChat or Instagram are completely absent while many other big name apps are outdated and receive updates much later than their Android and Apple counterparts.  I want to love this phone so bad but I can't help but regret wasting my upgrade on a device that simply isn't finished.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Speak
Reviews.Content: If you are a windows phone fan, you'll enjoy this phone a great deal.  No it doesn't have the powerful spec sheet of some of the newer phones on the market, but what matters is how the phone uses what it has under the hood. The Windows phone OS is top notch and runs as smooth as any OS on the market...probably smoother than the others.  Sprint probably won't be adding any of the Nokia phones to it's stores, so the HTC 8xt is the best you're going to get for now.  A great phone, amazing OS experience, and a terrific value.  If you are looking for something outside the box, you can't go wrong with this phone.CONS:  The windows store still does not offer many of the best apps.  This is changing slowly, but for now the app offerings are limited.  Many of the big apps (i.e. instagram, etc) are on windows phone now but still need upgrades in order to compete with the functionality of the other platforms' apps.

Reviews.Title: Super Phone!
Reviews.Author: tyler evins
Reviews.Content: Truly an amazing phone for both organization and fun. I have not enjoyed a phone so much since the days of palm treo's. This thing is amazing and has yet to disappoint. The only quirk is the calendar, it only allows limited and pre-set reminder times (ex: 1 hour, 18 hours, etc.) and this is, in my opinion, the ONLY drawback.

Reviews.Title: Hard to text it keeps jumping aroung
Reviews.Author: Thomas Dennis
Reviews.Content: Hard to text. the letters keep jumping around.  One person, I could never text. I took it to the Sprint store and they could not fix . I had to switch to a new pone. The new one keeps jumping letters around when you enter names and numbers to save

Reviews.Title: As a computer it's great, but not so good as a phone.
Reviews.Author: Intense Observation "Intense Observation"
Reviews.Content: Yep, for the cheap price you can't complain.  It's really great for texting and web surfing and YouTube stuff, but phone calls it's not so good. I've had it for months now, and at times it can be hard to understand other people and they sound like aliens. If you are very focused on the conversation you are having then you will get everything the person on the other line is saying, but it requires more acute attention.There were rare times where the phone would get stuck at zooming the home screen or the screen saver screen and I would have to restart the phone to get it back to normal view.The camera is ok, not hd quality.  Everything looks a bit pixilated and when you zoom in, it looks very pixilated.

Reviews.Title: New W8xt owner
Reviews.Author: Dennis E. Gutierrez
Reviews.Content: The phone was a nice transition from a 10 year ride with Blackberry. W8 is an easy OS to work with.A couple of things that I did notice, no alarm clock, they have an app for that. Stay away from the SCOUT navigation that comes with it. Sprint wants $4.99 a month for that, go to the shop and get the free "Drive Here" app, it works fantastic.This phones lacks good ring tones and you can't add a song from your phone to contacts unless you go to a laptop/computer for that function.The biggest thing that upset me, you cannot buy a holster for this phone. I have been looking. No accessories for this specific HTC product. Stay away from vendors who say HTC 8x and try to say that the 8xt is the same, they are not. Volume buttons on these two devices are NOT in the same place. I returning one now.Ciao.
